text: Denys Anatoliyovych Shmyhal (; born 15 October 1975) is a Ukrainian businessman and politician. On 4 March 2020, he became the Prime Minister of Ukraine. As Prime Minister, Shmyhal has been in charge of handling the response to the COVID-19 pandemic in Ukraine and conducting the defense of Ukraine during the 2022 Russian invasion. As of 2025, he is the longest serving prime minister in Ukrainian history. == Biography == Denys was born on 15 October 1975 in Lviv. In 1997, he graduated from the Lviv Polytechnic (engineering and economics). 1997-2005 he works as accountant in private sector. From June 2006 to August 2008, he was Director for the investment company Comfort-Invest. In 2008-2009, Shmyhal was General Director at Rosaninvest LLC. Shmyhal worked in multiple leading political roles in Ukraine's Lviv Oblast from 2009 until December 2013. In 2009-2013 served as the head of the Department of Economics and the head of the Department of Economic Development, Investment, Trade and Industryat the Lviv Oblast Administration. In 2015-2017 he was a Vice President of Lviv company Lvivkholod. In 2018-2019, Shmyhal was a Director of the Burshtyn TES. From August 2019 till February 2020 he was the Governor of Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast. On 4 February 2020, he became the Minister of Regional Development of Ukraine. In March 2020, Denys Shmyhal became the Prime Minister of Ukraine. == Personal life == Shmyhal is married to Kateryna. The couple has two daughters. ==References== Category:1975 births Category:Living people Category:Prime ministers of Ukraine Category:Ukrainian businesspeople Category:Current national leaders Category:Politicians from Lviv
title: Denys Shmyhal
